metadata.description:
This data set contains meteorological element observation data of huangcaogou station, upstream of heihe hydrometeorological observation network from January 1, 2014 to December 31, 2014.The station is located in huangcaogou village, ebao town, qilian county, qinghai province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 100.7312e, 38.0033n and 3137m above sea level.The air temperature and relative humidity sensors are located at 5m, facing due north.The barometer is installed in the anti-skid box on the ground;The tilting bucket rain gauge is installed at 10m;The wind speed and direction sensor is set at 10m, facing due north;The four-component radiometer is installed at 6m, facing due south;Two infrared thermometers are installed at 6m, facing due south, and the probe facing vertically downward;The soil temperature probe is buried at 0cm on the surface and 4cm underground, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm, 160cm, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil water probe is buried at 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.The soil heat flow plates (3 pieces) are buried in the ground 6cm underground, 2m to the south of the meteorological tower.
Observation projects are: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5m, RH_5m) (unit: c, percentage), pressure (Press) (unit: hundred mpa), precipitation (Rain) (unit: mm), wind speed (WS_10m) (unit: m/s), wind (WD_10m) (unit: degrees), the radiation of four component (DR, UR, DLR_Cor, ULR_Cor, Rn) (unit: watts per square meter), the surface radiation temperature (IRT_1, IRT_2) (unit:Soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2, Gs_3) (in watts/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0cm, Ts_4cm, Ts_10cm, Ts_20cm, Ts_80cm, Ts_120cm, Ts_160cm) (in Celsius), soil moisture (Ms_4cm, Ms_10cm, Ms_20cm, Ms_40cm, Ms_80cm, Ms_120cm, Ms_160cm) (unit: percentage).
Processing and quality control of observed data :(1) ensure 144 pieces of data every day (every 10min), and mark by -6999 in case of data missing;Between 8.23 and 10.25, the temperature fluctuation of 4cm soil is relatively large due to sensor problems, so the data can be used for reference.(2) excluding the time with duplicate records;(3) data that obviously exceeds the physical significance or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the part marked with red letter in the data is the data in question, and there are many questions about the measured wind direction of the station;(5) date and time have the same format, and date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: September 10, 2014, 10:30;(6) the naming rule is: AWS+ site name.8
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Li et al.(2013), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2014年1月1日至2014年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游黄草沟站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县峨堡镇黄草沟村，下垫面是高寒草地。观测点的经纬度是100.7312E, 38.0033N，海拔3137m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；8.23-10.25之间，由于传感器的问题，4cm土壤温度波动相对较大，数据可供参考使用。（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据，该站风向测量值疑问较多；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2014-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。8
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果的比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体表现为E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡度相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用10 Hz采样频率的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00到19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是利用热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热成像图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮度温度。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强对流条件下，TSEB模型也能产生可靠的E/ET%和T/ET%比率及ET的估计。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2，与EC系统的测量结果相比。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组分温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值很好地一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

In this paper, a suite of alpine hydrology datasets observed from an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin (HRB) is presented.
backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中扮演着重要角色，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，这就需要下一代观测和建模方法来推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是上游水源，需要进行调节以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文建模和相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进阿尔卑斯地区水文研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对阿尔卑斯水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在阿尔卑斯水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，它们影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是阿尔卑斯地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进阿尔卑斯水文研究，国际阿尔卑斯研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领阿尔卑斯地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱HRB生态水文过程的主要组成部分，阿尔卑斯水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪盖的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂移雪）。估计吹雪的发生非常重要，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：(1) 如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，(2) 如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及 (3) 如何扰动（气候变化和人类活动）改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形等几项严峻挑战，妨碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集，这阻碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游运营的两个气象站正常工作）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无缝的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，包含七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以调查气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。IOP结束后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，这些AMS位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在A’rou冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在十八个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络的角度研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无缺口的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（即冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂浮雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'four-component radiation' in meteorological measurements?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气象测量中，“四分量辐射”是指对辐射的四个不同成分进行测量和分析。这四个成分通常包括：直接辐射、散射辐射、反射辐射和地面辐射。通过对这些成分的测量，可以更全面地了解辐射的特性及其对气候和天气的影响。
Definition.AnswerEn: Four-component radiation refers to the measurement of solar and terrestrial radiation components, including downward shortwave radiation, upward shortwave radiation, downward longwave radiation, and upward longwave radiation. These measurements provide a comprehensive understanding of the energy balance at the Earth's surface, which is crucial for modeling surface fluxes and understanding energy exchanges in climate and hydrological studies.
Definition.AnswerCn: 四分量辐射是指对太阳辐射和地面辐射成分的测量，包括下行短波辐射、上行短波辐射、下行长波辐射和上行长波辐射。这些测量提供了对地表能量平衡的全面理解，这对于建模表面通量和理解气候与水文研究中的能量交换至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'soil and canopy component temperatures' and their significance in hydrological models?
Definition.QuestionCn: “土壤和树冠组分温度”是指土壤和植物树冠部分的温度。这些温度在水文模型中具有重要意义，因为它们影响蒸发、土壤水分动态和植物生长等过程，从而影响水循环和水资源管理。
Definition.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures refer to the distinct temperatures of the soil surface and the plant canopy as separate entities. These temperatures are critical for accurately estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration in hydrological models like the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model. Accurate estimation of these temperatures improves the understanding of energy exchanges and water cycles, particularly in heterogeneous landscapes where soil and vegetation contribute differently to the overall energy balance.
Definition.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度指的是土壤表面和植物冠层作为独立实体的不同温度。这些温度对于准确估计水文模型中的蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发（如双源能量平衡模型TSEB）至关重要。准确估计这些温度有助于更好地理解能量交换和水循环，特别是在土壤和植被对整体能量平衡贡献不同的异质景观中。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with collecting consistent and accurate hydrometeorological data in high-altitude alpine regions, and how might these be addressed with emerging technologies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔高山地区收集一致和准确的水文气象数据面临哪些挑战，以及如何利用新兴技术来应对这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The primary challenges in alpine regions include harsh climatic conditions, high altitudes, and complex topography, which hinder consistent data collection. Emerging technologies, such as automated meteorological stations, wireless sensor networks, and advanced remote sensing instruments, can address these challenges by providing continuous, high-resolution data across difficult terrain, thereby facilitating improved monitoring and modeling of hydrological processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区的主要挑战包括恶劣的气候条件、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了一致的数据收集。新兴技术，如自动气象站、无线传感器网络和先进的遥感仪器，可以通过在困难地形中提供连续的高分辨率数据来应对这些挑战，从而促进水文过程的改进监测和建模。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways might the understanding and modeling of freeze-thaw cycles influence the development of hydrological datasets and models in cold region ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 冻融循环的理解和建模可能会以何种方式影响寒冷地区生态系统中水文数据集和模型的发展？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Understanding freeze-thaw cycles is crucial because they affect soil moisture and temperature, influencing water infiltration, runoff, and groundwater flow. Detailed modeling of these cycles can enhance the accuracy of hydrological datasets and models in cold regions by providing insights into the dynamic interactions between soil thermal properties and hydrological processes. This understanding supports the development of predictive models that can simulate the impacts of climate change on water resources in these sensitive ecosystems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 理解冻融循环至关重要，因为它们影响土壤湿度和温度，从而影响水的渗透、径流和地下水流动。对这些循环的详细建模可以提高寒冷地区水文数据集和模型的准确性，提供土壤热特性与水文过程之间动态相互作用的洞察。这种理解支持开发预测模型，能够模拟气候变化对这些敏感生态系统水资源的影响。

Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions due to access difficulties and technological barriers has hindered research and modeling. Remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes, though uncertainties in remote sensing data, especially in alpine regions, must be validated and calibrated.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于进入困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了研究和建模。结合遥感数据和数据同化可以改善水文过程的预测，但必须验证和校准遥感数据中的不确定性，尤其是在阿尔卑斯地区。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of accurately estimating surface fluxes in advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在有强烈平流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量的挑战因素包括哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. This often leads to overestimation of component temperatures, affecting the model performance. Additionally, a strong advective environment contributes to this challenge.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为从表面复合辐射温度中确定表层土壤和植被组分温度时会出现误差。这通常导致对组分温度的高估，从而影响模型的性能。此外，强对流环境也加剧了这一挑战。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of implementing integrated and multiscale observation networks on the quality and applicability of hydrometeorological datasets in alpine regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区实施综合和多尺度观测网络对水文气象数据集的质量和适用性可能产生的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing integrated and multiscale observation networks can significantly enhance the quality and applicability of hydrometeorological datasets by providing accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, validating remote sensing products, and improving the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. These networks can help address the challenges posed by the cold climate, high altitude, and complex topography, thus overcoming data scarcity and enabling more comprehensive research in alpine hydrology.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施综合和多尺度观测网络可以显著提高水文气象数据集的质量和适用性，为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，验证遥感产品，并改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。这些网络可以帮助应对寒冷气候、高海拔和复杂地形带来的挑战，从而克服数据稀缺问题，促进高山水文学的更全面研究。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of high-resolution thermal cameras in data collection influence the estimation accuracy of evapotranspiration components in agricultural areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热成像相机在数据收集中的使用如何影响农业地区蒸散发组成部分的估算准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal cameras allows for the accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures, which significantly enhances the estimation accuracy of evapotranspiration components. By providing precise input data for models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, these cameras facilitate the reliable separation of soil and vegetation latent heat fluxes, even under strongly advective conditions, leading to improved estimations of evaporation, transpiration, and overall evapotranspiration.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪的使用可以准确测量土壤和冠层组件的温度，这显著提高了蒸散发成分的估算精度。通过为像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型提供精确的输入数据，这些相机能够在强烈的平流条件下可靠地分离土壤和植被的潜热通量，从而改善蒸发、蒸腾和整体蒸散发的估算。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed in the data quality control and processing of meteorological data collected from automatic weather stations in remote and challenging environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在偏远和具有挑战性的环境中，从自动气象站收集的气象数据的数据质量控制和处理采用了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In the context of the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, data quality control and processing involve several steps: (1) Ensuring that data is collected consistently with 144 data points per day, each recorded every 10 minutes. Missing data is marked with a placeholder value (-6999). (2) Removing duplicate records and data that are physically unrealistic or exceed instrument ranges. (3) Addressing discrepancies, such as those with soil temperature due to sensor issues, by marking them for reference. (4) Standardizing the date and time format to ensure uniformity across the dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，数据质量控制和处理涉及几个步骤：（1）确保数据以每天144个数据点的一致方式收集，每个数据点每10分钟记录一次。缺失的数据用占位符值（-6999）标记。（2）删除重复记录和物理上不合理或超出仪器范围的数据。（3）处理不一致性，例如由于传感器问题导致的土壤温度异常，通过标记以供参考。（4）标准化日期和时间格式，以确保数据集的一致性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can snow cover properties and their dynamics be effectively observed and measured in alpine regions with complex terrain and harsh climates?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何在复杂地形和恶劣气候的高山地区有效观察和测量雪盖特性及其动态？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: In alpine regions like the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin, snow cover properties are observed using a snow observation superstation equipped with state-of-the-art techniques and instruments. Snow depth is measured by ultrasonic sensors, and snow water equivalent (SWE) is measured by GammaMONitor devices. Blowing snow flux is observed using specialized instruments like the FlowCapt, which measures snow grain movement at various heights to capture redistribution processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 在像黑河流域上游这样的高山地区，使用配备先进技术和仪器的雪观测超级站观察雪盖特性。雪深通过超声波传感器进行测量，雪水当量（SWE）通过GammaMONitor设备进行测量。吹雪通量使用专门仪器如FlowCapt进行观察，该仪器在不同高度测量雪粒运动，以捕捉再分配过程。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the comprehensive methods used to observe and integrate soil temperature and moisture data for hydrological modeling in frozen ground conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在冻土条件下，观察和整合土壤温度和湿度数据以进行水文模型的综合方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To observe soil temperature and moisture in frozen ground conditions, an integrated observation network is utilized. This network consists of automatic meteorological stations and frozen ground superstations, where soil temperature and moisture are measured at multiple layers down to a depth of 3.2 meters. These measurements capture freeze-thaw cycles and provide high-resolution soil physics data. Additionally, thermal and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil are measured to observe dynamic hydrothermal processes. This data is crucial for parameterizing alpine hydrological models and validating remote sensing products.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了观察冻土条件下的土壤温度和湿度，采用了一个综合观测网络。该网络由自动气象站和冻土超级站组成，土壤温度和湿度在多个层次上测量，深度可达3.2米。这些测量捕捉了冻融循环，并提供了高分辨率的土壤物理数据。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态的水热过程。这些数据对于参数化高山水文模型和验证遥感产品至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technologies and equipment are utilized in capturing detailed soil and canopy component temperatures for hydrological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在水文研究中，捕捉详细的土壤和冠层组件温度所使用的技术和设备包括：
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technologies used include high-resolution thermal infrared cameras, which are manually operated on boundary layer towers to capture thermal radiation of cropland. This involves using thermal images collected during the daytime and converting them into radiation temperatures based on incoming long-wave radiation and soil and canopy emissivities.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 所使用的技术包括高分辨率热红外相机，这些相机在边界层塔上手动操作，以捕捉农田的热辐射。这涉及在白天收集的热图像，并根据入射的长波辐射以及土壤和冠层的发射率将其转换为辐射温度。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do remote sensing products integrated with ground-based observations contribute to the validation and improvement of alpine hydrological models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感产品与地面观测相结合如何有助于验证和改进高山水文模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Remote sensing products, when validated using fine-resolution data from superstations, contribute to the improvement of alpine hydrological models by providing accurate forcing data and validating model predictions against observed meteorological and hydrological variables, such as snow cover and freeze-thaw processes.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感产品通过使用来自超级站的高分辨率数据进行验证，有助于改善高山水文模型，因为它们提供了准确的强迫数据，并将模型预测与观测到的气象和水文变量（如雪盖和冻融过程）进行对比验证。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be significant challenges in collecting consistent and complete data in high-altitude or alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在高海拔或高山地区收集一致和完整数据可能面临重大挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The challenges in collecting consistent and complete data in alpine regions are attributed to the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，收集一致和完整数据的挑战归因于寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了数据收集，并妨碍了遥感技术和水文模型的发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are some potential reasons why uncertainty might be high in the estimation of hydrological processes using remote sensing data in alpine regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用遥感数据估计高山地区水文过程时，不确定性可能较高的潜在原因有哪些？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Uncertainty in estimating hydrological processes using remote sensing data in alpine regions may arise from complexities in the earth system, difficulties in accessing accurate observation data, and the need for validation and calibration of remote sensing data, especially due to conditions like snow cover and frozen ground.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，利用遥感数据估计水文过程的不确定性可能源于地球系统的复杂性、获取准确观测数据的困难，以及遥感数据验证和校准的需求，尤其是在雪盖和冻土等条件下。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might data assimilation and validation be crucial in advancing predictive understanding in alpine hydrology research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 数据同化和验证在推进高山水文学研究中的预测理解方面可能至关重要，原因如下：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data assimilation and validation are crucial because they improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate forcing data, validating remote sensing data, and evaluating distributed models, which is important for understanding alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 数据同化和验证至关重要，因为它们通过提供准确的强迫数据、验证遥感数据和评估分布式模型来提高水文过程的预测，这对于理解高山水文过程和生态系统功能非常重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the primary challenges in ensuring the accuracy of data collected from automatic meteorological stations in high-altitude alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 确保在高海拔阿尔卑斯地区收集的自动气象站数据准确性的主要挑战是什么？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The primary challenges include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit complete and consistent data collection. These factors can hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. In addition, the scarcity of observation data due to difficulties of access and technological barriers presents significant challenges.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素阻碍了完整和一致的数据收集。这些因素可能会妨碍遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。此外，由于获取困难和技术障碍，观测数据的稀缺也带来了重大挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective are the current data collection methods in capturing the complex interactions between snow cover, frozen ground, and hydrological processes in alpine environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 当前的数据收集方法在捕捉高山环境中雪盖、冻土和水文过程之间复杂相互作用方面的有效性如何？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Current data collection methods involve gap-free meteorological and hydrological data monitored from an integrated observation network, including automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground. These methods aim to provide accurate forcing data and validate remote sensing products and hydrological models. However, challenges such as strong winds affecting snow density data and technological barriers in remote areas can limit effectiveness.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 当前的数据收集方法涉及从一个综合观测网络中监测无间隙的气象和水文数据，包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土的超级站。这些方法旨在提供准确的强迫数据，并验证遥感产品和水文模型。然而，强风对雪密度数据的影响以及偏远地区的技术障碍等挑战可能会限制其有效性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm uncertain about how the data collection methods are adapted to address the challenges of data scarcity in alpine regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对数据收集方法如何适应阿尔卑斯地区数据稀缺的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To address the challenges of data scarcity in alpine regions, a distributed and multiscale observation network has been established, comprising automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. These networks provide consistent hydrometeorological data and use state-of-the-art techniques to capture snow accumulation and freeze-thaw processes, supporting the development of hydrological models and remote sensing validation.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了解决高山地区数据稀缺的问题，建立了一个分布式和多尺度的观测网络，包含自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站。这些网络提供一致的水文气象数据，并采用先进技术捕捉雪积累和冻融过程，支持水文模型的开发和遥感验证。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how remote sensing data can be effectively integrated with ground-based observations to improve the prediction of hydrological processes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何有效地将遥感数据与地面观测相结合，以改善水文过程的预测。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, when combined with ground-based observation networks, can improve the prediction of hydrological processes by providing accurate and effective forcing data for hydrological models. These integrated datasets help validate remote sensing products and support the evaluation of distributed models, ultimately enhancing the predictive understanding of these processes.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与地面观测网络相结合，可以通过为水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据来改善水文过程的预测。这些综合数据集有助于验证遥感产品，并支持分布式模型的评估，最终增强对这些过程的预测理解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not clear on how datasets can be expanded to better capture snow cover and frozen ground dynamics in complex alpine terrains.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚如何扩展数据集以更好地捕捉复杂高山地形中的雪盖和冻土动态。
Assertion.AnswerEn: To better capture snow cover and frozen ground dynamics in complex alpine terrains, datasets can be expanded through an integrated observation network that includes superstations for snow and frozen ground. These stations collect detailed snow properties and high-resolution soil physics data to understand freeze-thaw cycles, enhance model parameterization, and validate remote sensing data at different scales.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 为了更好地捕捉复杂高山地形中的雪盖和冻土动态，可以通过集成观测网络扩展数据集，该网络包括用于雪和冻土的超级站。这些站点收集详细的雪属性和高分辨率的土壤物理数据，以理解冻融循环，增强模型参数化，并在不同尺度上验证遥感数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in collecting data for evapotranspiration estimation models in heterogeneous landscapes and propose potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在异质景观中收集蒸散发估算模型数据所面临的挑战，并提出潜在的解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting data for evapotranspiration estimation in heterogeneous landscapes include the difficulty in accurately measuring soil and canopy component temperatures and the complex atmospheric and surface interactions. Errors from image classification during temperature derivation and uncertainties in radiative flux measurements further complicate the process. Potential solutions involve improving classification techniques to reduce pixel misclassification, using high-resolution thermal cameras for better temperature accuracy, and employing stable isotopes and EC systems for validation. Incorporating integrated observation networks and enhancing remote sensing data assimilation could also address these challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中收集蒸散发估算数据的挑战包括准确测量土壤和冠层组分温度的困难，以及复杂的大气和表面相互作用。温度推导过程中图像分类的错误和辐射通量测量的不确定性进一步复杂化了这一过程。潜在的解决方案包括改进分类技术以减少像素误分类，使用高分辨率热像仪以提高温度准确性，以及采用稳定同位素和EC系统进行验证。整合观测网络和增强遥感数据同化也可以解决这些挑战。
